text: How an Asian-American lawyer, whose name was buried in the footnotes of a landmark Supreme Court case, helped pave the way for interracial marriage. https://t.co/UwlNxm26aX

name: NewYorker
text: Admitting a mistake while claiming ignorance, like General Mark Milley and Republican lawmakers have recently done, is a way of abdicating responsibility, @mashagessen writes. “History is familiar with this trick and does not look kindly on it.” https://t.co/lGSaaKu3XO

name: NewYorker
text: Frank Ramsey—a philosopher, economist, and mathematician—was one of the greatest minds of the last century. Have we caught up with him yet? https://t.co/wWjsJYVYWO

name: NewYorker
text: "I’m not looking for American heroism," the economist Jeffrey Sachs said. "I’m looking for the United States not to be among the most destructive forces on the planet right now." https://t.co/fHwy92lc5E

name: NewYorker
text:
Not all novels should be, or could be, as playful as this one, Dave Eggers writes, "but it wouldn’t hurt to have a few more that allow humans—characters, readers, authors even—to laugh."
